setDescription(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets an optional description to be shown in the UI when the user is asked to save. Typically, it describes how the data will be stored by the service, so it can help users to decide whether they can trust the service to save their data.

@B_android#view#autofill#AutofillId_E@
AutofillId: id of fields whose value will be sanitized. This value must never be null.
Throws: if a sanitizer for any of the ids has already been added or if ids is empty.
addSanitizer(android.service.autofill.Sa.Description: Adds a sanitizer for one or more field. When a sanitizer is set for a field, the @B_android#view#autofill#AutofillValue_E@ is sent to the sanitizer before a save request is Typically used to avoid displaying the save UI for values that are autofilled but reformattedby the app. For example, to remove spaces between every 4 digits of a credit card number: The same sanitizer can be reused to sanitize multiple fields. For example, to trim both the username and password fields: The sanitizer can also be used as an alternative for a @B_android#service#autofill#SaveInfo#Builder#setValidator_E@. If any of the ids is a @B_android#service#autofill#SaveInfo#Builder#SaveInfo#Builder_E@ and the sanitizer fails because of it, then the save UI is not shown.
addSanitizer(android.service.autofill.Sa.FullName: public SaveInfo.Builder addSanitizer (Sanitizer sanitizer, AutofillId... ids)

setNegativeAction(int,android.content.In.Description: Sets the style and listener for the negative save action. This allows an autofill service to customize the style and be notified when the user selects the negative action in the save UI. Note that selecting the negative action regardless of its style and listener being customized would dismiss the save UI and if a custom listener intent is provided then this intent is started. The default style is @B_android#service#autofill#SaveInfo#NEGATIVE_BUTTON_STYLE_CANCEL_E@

setValidator(android.service.autofill.Va.Description: Sets an object used to validate the user input - if the input is not valid, the autofill save UI is not shown. Typically used to validate credit card numbers. Examples: Validator for a credit number that must have exactly 16 digits: Validator for a credit number that must pass a Luhn checksum and either have 16 digits, or 15 digits starting with 108: OR part: Validator for a credit number contained in just 4 fields and that must have exactly 4 digits on each field:
